This problem happens inconsitently when you open any of the property editors
(border, font , color) and start using them.

In this case, I opened the font editor and typed 'A'  in the list wanting to
scroll to Arial font. This caused the crash.  If you use the mouse to interact
with the windows , they seem to work. It has happened to me before when using
the border editor.

Furthermore the property editors to not come to the front consistently. i.e.
they seem to hide behind the main eclipse window.

This is a show stopper. You have restart eclipse to reset everything.

Although the message says it has trace in the log, I could not find any more
trace dump.


Cheers

On my Win/XP machine this is a firewall problem! I use "Outpost" which allows
quiet a detailed configuration, still I cannot customize the firewall for proper
VEP usage yet. Switching the firewall off, VEP runs allright.

(In reply to comment #0)

> 
> Furthermore the property editors to not come to the front consistently. i.e.
> they seem to hide behind the main eclipse window.
> 

This is a limitation in VE because of the way the Windows OS works. You have to
select the property editor from the task bar in some cases. Other times in will
come to the front.

The "IWAV0170I Connection creation failed" problem is a more severe problem and
looks like it's due to you're firewall (as you stated). I think there is a way
to setup your hosts file to used local host correctly.

Rich, can you comment on this since you are the expert in this area. 
Thx... Peter
*** Bug 105403 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

We do sockets. We use "localhost" and any available socket. We use TCP/IP to
come up with free sockets to use. We can't use any hard-coded sockets because we
use a variable amount that changes all of the time. So we let TCP/IP come up
with the socket.

Your firewall needs to be able to allow localhost connections to any socket from
javaw.exe. I don't know how to configure your firewall to do this. I don't know
anything about Outpost.
